definition: to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
variant of 翻[fan1]
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: Lazio are in command but we can still bounce back.
sentences.chinese: 拉齐奥整装待命，但是我们依然能够翻盘。

sentences.english: The Spain defeat now means that this afternoon is sudden death.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙的翻盘意味著这个下午事关生死。

sentences.english: Can you explain why it has changed?
sentences.chinese: 你能解释下为什么会翻盘？

victorious/to win/to triumph

to defeat/to beat
match point (tennis etc)
to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents

to pull back/to regain (one's dignity etc)/to recover from (an adverse situation)/to turn the tables
